Ball & Chain - Bar Review | Cond√© Nast Traveler Skip to main content Newsletter Sign In Search Search Newsletter Inspiration Destinations Places to Stay News & Advice Curated Escapes Shopping Cruise Women Who Travel Video North America Chevron United States Chevron Florida Chevron Miami Chevron Review: Ball & Chain A taste of Little Havana history with a side of stress relief. Photos Save Story Save this story Save Story Save this story Reviewed by Jennifer M. Wood First impression? The first thing you notice about Ball & Chain is that green and white awning, beckoning nighthawks to Little Havana for decades. Originally opened in 1935, the historic space has seen many changes‚Äîand owners‚Äîover the years, yet it kept hints of the past, like the original pine ceiling that Billie Holiday and Count Basie played under. If it‚Äôs a quiet night you‚Äôre after, look elsewhere; the venue‚Äôs two stages are always delivering great jazz and spirited salsa. So who‚Äôs there? You won‚Äôt find a single wallflower at Ball & Chain. The historic spot is a celebratory one‚Äîjazz music fills the air, flamenco dancers are regulars, and salsa dancing lessons are part of the weekly lineup. This is a crowd that embraces classic Miami nightlife‚Äîand their enthusiasm is contagious. You‚Äôll be on your feet practicing your own moves in no time. How are the drinks? While live music and dancing are the main draw at Ball & Chain, the Cuban theme translates to the food and drink offerings. The rum-heavy menu keeps it classic with mojitos and bananita daiquiris, and brings in some local flavors with its Calle Ocho Old Fashioned (aged rum with tobacco infused bitters and tobacco leaf) and the Miami Mule (vodka, ginger beer, and fresh Key lime juice). Worth ordering something to eat, too? While most people think of Ball & Chain as a nightclub, it‚Äôs also a full-service‚Äîand very solid‚ÄîCuban restaurant that opens for lunch each day at noon. The tapas-style menu includes house-made sweet plantain chips and Cuban sandwiches. Did the staff do you right? Given the constant buzz of music, movement, and activity, service can sometimes be slow. But the positive vibes that the place and its denizens are giving off make that a minor thing. Bottom line: what are we coming here for? While Ball & Chain can easily make for a fun-filled date night, it‚Äôll work much better with a partner who‚Äôs eager to let his or hair down. Otherwise, it makes a great spot for meeting up‚Äîand catching up‚Äîwith a group of friends who embrace an old-school Miami party vibe. We understand that time is the greatest luxury, which is why Cond√© Nast Traveler mines its network of experts and influencers so that you never waste a meal, a drink, or a hotel stay wherever you are in the world. Absolute scam, it's been ten months and not a single item or response as to why. Do not purchase anything from here, a good alternative would be strange ways February 17, 2021 Unprompted review MM Mckael Moffat US ‚Ä¢ 1 review Jan 31, 2021 Never got order I ordered from them before and never really had an issue always got my product and what not. However about six months ago I ordered a snow globe that was on sale never got it never had an email or anything and now their website is down and their Instagram  too. Super sus don‚Äôt buy from them. It was only $11 dollars so I just let it go but I‚Äôm still annoyed. January 31, 2021 Unprompted review WW Westland Wyvern US ‚Ä¢ 1 review Oct 11, 2020 Maintenance? I never had an issue with this business before, but if their website has been undergoing maintenance for nearly two months, that's how you know they're in deep doo doo. October 11, 2020 Unprompted review deanna kay US ‚Ä¢ 5 reviews Oct 10, 2020 Do not buy from here Do not buy from here. Took my money, no emails, no posts on Instagram, no product received. October 10, 2020 Unprompted review Consumer US ‚Ä¢ 1 review Updated Sep 22, 2020 This company sucks right now This company sucks right now, and looks like it's going out of business because of it....Woodie has always been rude, but at least back in the day your order would get filled. But these days you place an order and don't even hear from them after that. Hard pass. September 22, 2020 Unprompted review DI David in STL US ‚Ä¢ 1 review Aug 6, 2020 BALL & CHAIN CO. SUX! Take your money. Never ship your purchase. Ignore email inquiries. BALL & CHAIN CO. is a COMPLETE RIP-OFF!!!! Never spend money with them... August 6, 2020 Unprompted review AC Alastair Champion CA ‚Ä¢ 1 review Jul 1, 2020 Just avoid them Same thing, used to order a lot in the past and the company was great. Now I‚Äôve been out $80usd for 2 months, have heard nothing back over the past month of me sending weekly emails (tried different emails as a post suggested) and still nothing. I‚Äôve opened a dispute with my card. It‚Äôs a shame to see a company that I used to really enjoy supporting just become garbage. July 1, 2020 Unprompted review AH Arianne Hallett US ‚Ä¢ 2 reviews Jun 23, 2020 Ordered from them a couple years ago‚Ä¶ Ordered from them a couple years ago and everything was fine... I placed an order about a month ago and only got a confirmation email and that‚Äôs about it... really wish I read these reviews before! I‚Äôve been trying to contact them and just like everyone else I get no response.. Hopefully I will be able to figure something out with my bank because this is really unprofessional. Done. June 23, 2020 Unprompted review DA DANNY US ‚Ä¢ 1 review Updated May 14, 2020 this brand is CANCELLED I've received items from them in the past (and suprisingly loved them.) But a few times they've  just completely ripped me off. Customer service is non existent. They pick and choose who's orders they fix. I had to be very passive aggressive in the email to actually get them to send my stuff out lol. I would not recommend buying anything from here unless you're fine with possibly never getting anything out of it. They also have the comments turned off on their Instagram account, probably because a lot of people aren't receiving their stuff and they don't want to be exposed as the scam artist they are. If that isn't a big RED FLAG idk what is. Shame on the brand owners, whoever is processing the order, and whoever runs the disgrace they call customer service. THIS BRAND NEEDS TO BE EXPOSED. May 14, 2020 Unprompted review TB Tayler Berez US ‚Ä¢ 1 review May 8, 2020 DONT BUY FROM THEM, They will block you on social media, not respond to your emails. I bought an item from then on April 10th. 2 weeks later I emailed them saying pretty much that I understand that shipping may be delayed because of covid and I completely understand but just wanted to know when they would expect it to ship. No answer then after 4 weeks I emailed them. No answer. Then I direct messaged them saying I‚Äôd just prefer money back. No answer. Then a few days pass and I realized all their comments are turned off so no one can comment. So then I googled them and tons of people have said the same thing happened to them so i posted all those reviews on Instagram yesterday and then emailed them again. Then I woke up this morning  to a refund from them, no email response and when I went to look at their insta I realized they blocked me. I‚Äôm lucky I got my money back, but it‚Äôs probably because i scared them in my last email. DONT BUY FROM THEM May 8, 2020 Unprompted review JN Josh Neely US ‚Ä¢ 1 review Mar 9, 2020 THIS COMPANY IS A COMPLETE SCAM!!!!!! THIS COMPANY IS A COMPLETE SCAM! If I could give them a worse review than a 1 star, I would with no hesitation. I really wish I would have read reviews on the company before I made my purchase. Ordered a couple things from them and a month later, USPS hasn't even recieved my package from them yet. Dont be a sucker like me, exit there site while you still can! March 9, 2020 Unprompted review SO Sophie US ‚Ä¢ 1 review Feb 4, 2020 They are terrible They are terrible, if you go on their Instagram they have disabled comments. I used to order stuff for them and never had an issue. I ordered a tapestry and it‚Äôs been a month. I got the shipping email 2 weeks ago and it says it hasn‚Äôt even made it to the post office. This is a scam. February 4, 2020 Unprompted review DG Daniel Goodstone GB ‚Ä¢ 1 review Updated Feb 19, 2020 Update Feb 2020, not crooks after all, oops My original review here was one star, as I was convinced they'd stolen my money and were ignoring my messages. This is an update after finally recieving my stuff. So about two months after I made my order, and after trying in vain to message the company on every social media platform they have- I read somewhere that sending multiple emails to them might end up with your messages simply being marked as spam. Doesn't excuse the fact that my very first email was also ignored, BUT- after all that time I used a different email address to contact support @ ballandchainco.com (without the spaces of course) and they literally replied within 15 minutes. Apparently something went wrong with their new fulfilment system and a bunch of orders weren't processed properly. I'd have appreciated more than a brief sorry (after 2 months I was kinda hoping for a voucher code haha) I'm also a touch suspicious that my order was suddenly marked shipped that same day I emailed, but in the end everything I paid for was sent out and I didn't lose my ¬£30. They made it very hard to contact them, but I hadn't used that specific email before, and it worked far better than the contact form on their page. Overall I'm happy with the product, not so happy they took two months to notice they had orders that were never sent. Here's hoping it's all sorted out and I can order from them without issue from now on, as the things they sell are great. January 20, 2020 Unprompted review TB Theo Bareis US ‚Ä¢ 1 review Jan 9, 2020 $70 dollars in the hole, nothing to show for it Placed two orders on the 8th of December, got confirmation emails and then never heard another word from the company. I‚Äôve emailed multiple times and requested a refund, no reply. I‚Äôm just assuming they stole my money, just like everyone else has dealt with. I ordered almost 70 dollars worth of stuff with 2 day shipping and now it‚Äôs 2020 with no sign of my stuff. January 9, 2020 Unprompted review Kathy Pudmanski US ‚Ä¢ 2 reviews Jan 7, 2020 So wish I read these reviews before‚Ä¶ So wish I read these reviews before purchase. Ordered a tapestry on 12/19. Order confirmed. sent emails asking where the order is. No response. Will be disputing charges. I live in NC where there are located and it‚Äôs not like they have to ship far. January 7, 2020 Unprompted review LI Lilith US ‚Ä¢ 1 review Jan 3, 2020 Taking Money - Not Sending Products... I have bought from Ball and Chain several times over the past five years and have never had a problem. However, it appears as though they are under new management or just don't give a damn about their customers in the last few months. Really disappointed I couldn't get gifts for my sister's birthday, even though I spent almost $70 and paid way before their birthday so it would arrive on time. After I didn't hear back about a tracking number, I reached out and emailed the support team. I gave them the 3 business days it said it would take to get back. No response. I reached out two more times... *crickets* so I ended up having to dispute the charges with my bank because they literally are just taking money and not sending people their orders. A real bummer considering how much I enjoy their products. I hope this gets resolved soon and I can write them a better review. January 3, 2020 Unprompted review Ravan Kennedy US ‚Ä¢ 1 review Updated Dec 29, 2019 If I could rank them lower I would Do NOT buy from this company. I placed an order 12/14, paid for 2-3 day shipping, and got the email confirming my order on that same day, but when I hadn't gotten a shipping email after 9 days of waiting I tried reaching out, but with no response, one email requesting to just cancel my order and give me my money back. I finally received a shipping email on 12/27, rather than getting my money back like I'd prefer. It shouldn't take 13 days to get my package shipped, and you should be able to get SOME kind of response from them. The comments on their instagram are disabled and with this kind of service I'm not surprised why. They don't want to get called out on their social media for their completely poor service. Never ordering from them again and I suggest you don't either. December 29, 2019 Unprompted review MA Mae US ‚Ä¢ 3 reviews Dec 23, 2019 Horrible customer service, convinced they stole my money I have been a fan of Ball and Chain Co's merch for a while and wanted to get my boyfriend something as a stocking stuffer. I bought 50.00 worth of pins on black Friday. I was sent a shipping confirmation email with a shipping code on 12/4. its the 23rd, two days before Christmas and i have received NO updates in regards to when the item is actually shipping, just that the label was created on 12/4. I have emailed them at least 6 times, messaged them on FB and Instagram with no reply. They have their comments turned off on their photos on Instagram probably so people arent constantly blasting them. I placed my order through the afterpay company called Sezzle and I am contacting them today to try to get my money back. I wouldn't have cared if the item came after Christmas, some communication would be nice. If they are having issues getting the items from a distributor or whatever, i can be patient but a month with no communication and after multiple attempts to reaching out to them - I'm angry and let down. December 23, 2019 Unprompted review GE Genna US ‚Ä¢ 2 reviews Dec 23, 2019 Same as the other reviews here Same as the other reviews here. Ball & Chain Founders Announce New Restaurant Business Venture in Little Havana | RestaurantNews.com Home Restaurant News Feed Reviews Subscribe Send News Advertising Restaurant Franchise Opportunities About Contact Privacy Ball & Chain Founders Announce New Restaurant Business Venture in Little Havana October 15, 2018 ¬∑ ¬∑ Facebook Tweet LinkedIn Taquerias el Mexicano is Under New Ownership and There Will be a Novelty Candy Store Miami, FL¬† ( RestaurantNews.com )¬† The co-founders who are behind bringing the legendary Ball & Chain back to life four years ago, Zack Bush, Ben Bush and Bill Fuller, are thrilled to announce their next business venture in Little Havana. Mad Room Hospitality is pleased to officially announce they have acquired ownership of the iconic Calle Ocho Mexican spot, Taquerias el Mexicano. The authentic Mexican restaurant, who first opened its doors in 1985 at 521 SW 8 th Street, has been a long-standing landmark on the Ocho.¬† The Bush brothers and Fuller all share the same passion to preserve old concepts (like Ball & Chain) while adding modern twists.¬† ‚Äú Just like we do with all of our Mad Room Hospitality concepts, we want to keep the venue as authentic as possible‚Äìseveral key employees that have been an integral part of the restaurant for 15-20 years have played a crucial role in ensuring the integrity of this landmark establishment ‚Äù says co-owner and one of Miami‚Äôs leading nightlife veterans, Zack Bush, ‚Äú from the recipes, to the d√©cor and pricing, we want to keep the identity fully intact . We are proud and honored to carry the Taquerias torch on Calle Ocho ‚Äù. Taquerias el Mexicano is a legendary piece of Calle Ocho history having been in operation for over 30 years serving authentic Mexican fare in a vibrant family-friendly atmosphere.¬† The 2,100 square foot space offers a full-service sit-down option for diners, features a full bar and craft cocktail menu as well as take-out and delivery available.¬† ¬†The food menu will remain the same‚Äìoffering traditional Mexican favorites for lunch and dinner including tacos, tortas, burritos, flautas, enchiladas and fajitas.¬† All tortillas are handmade in-house daily, and the signature mole recipe contains 17 ingredients and is still a house favorite.¬† Breakfast is served daily offering a small variety of dishes such as Huevos Rancheros and Chilaquiles. No meal is complete without dessert and now guests will have the option for a one-of-a-kind experience at Los Altos Dulceria.¬† Located upstairs directly above the restaurant, Los Altos is a Mexican novelty store and candy shop set to open in late October 2018.¬† Guests will be able to hand-pick authentic Mexican sweets and candy and dress up and purchase costumes as well. Taquerias el Mexico will also be launching their own line of branded candy available for purchase in-store and online. New owners Zack & Ben Bush and Bill Fuller took this new ownership responsibility very seriously having traveled to Mexico several times on research and development trips to ensure full authenticity of the food and cocktails.¬† It was there they met renowned bartender Erick Gaytan , who they commissioned to consult and modify the Taquerias el Mexicano cocktail menu.¬† Gaytan is a legend in Mexico, who‚Äôs passion for mezcal and tropical cocktails made for an ideal collaboration for a Mexican restaurant in Miami.¬† The star of the menu is still the ‚ÄúLa Famosa Frozen Horchata,‚Äù created from a homemade secret recipe.¬† Authentic Mexican classics also decorate the menu including the ‚ÄúPaloma Tradicional,‚Äù Sangrita and ‚ÄúFrozen Sombreros,‚Äù (frozen margaritas).¬† Happy Hour is offered daily from 3pm ‚Äì 7pm featuring two-for-one margaritas and beers. For more information please visit: www.calleochotacos.com Contact: Cheryl Kate Hohweiler Trinity Group PR cheryl@trinitygrouppr.com 732-642-1724 Facebook Tweet LinkedIn Filed in: Press Release Tags: Ball & Chain , restaurant , restaurant news , Taquerias el Mexicano Restaurant Franchise Opportunities Recent Restaurant News KRISPY KREME Celebrates International Chocolate Day With Return of Fan Favorite Chocolate Original Glazed Doughnuts, This Thursday Through Sunday Federal Court Dismisses Meritless Lawsuit Against Dickey‚Äôs Executive, Vindicating Company Huge Comeback Calls for Huge Bowls: Teriyaki Madness Returns to Albuquerque Sept. 19 Polly‚Äôs Pies Celebrates Oktoberfest with Authentic German Flavors and Pumpkin Favorites FACE Amusement and Guy Fieri Foundation Bring Teddy Bears to Central Park for the Annual New York City Buddy Walk Huddle House Launches Smashed Burger Week in Honor of National Cheeseburger Day Restaurant Franchise News from The Taco Spot, Rock N‚Äô Roll Sushi, Newk‚Äôs Eatery, and More! Ball & Chain Owners File Multi-Million Dollar Suit Alleging Harassment From Miami Officials ‚Äì NBC 6 South Florida Skip to content Main Navigation Search Search for: Local Weather Video On Your Side Investigates Responds Newsletters TV Listings Watch 24/7 Create profile / Log in Dashboard Email preferences Sign out Trending üå™Ô∏èHurricane Season 6 to Know üì∫Watch News 24/7 üîé Send a Tip What‚Äôs Being Built Here Money Chat Dangerous Drive Newsletters How to Stream Expand Miami Ball & Chain Owners File Multi-Million Dollar Suit Alleging Harassment From Miami Officials The nearly $28 million lawsuit claims city leaders instituted raid-style inspections, some at peak business hours, and "deliberately crafted" city ordinances targeting Ball & Chain. By NBC 6 ‚Ä¢ Published September 30, 2021 ‚Ä¢ Updated on September 30, 2021 at 11:28 pm BOOKMARKER NBC Universal, Inc. The owners of several businesses in Little Havana ‚Äî including the popular Ball & Chain ‚Äî have filed a federal lawsuit against the City of Miami, alleging they weaponized city departments to run those once-booming businesses out of town. The 66-page lawsuit, filed Thursday by the Mad Room Hospitality¬†‚Äî which owns Ball & Chain and Taquerias el Mexicano, along with other businesses ‚Äî seeks $27.9 million in damages from the city. Watch NBC6 free wherever you are WATCH HERE The lawsuit claims city leaders instituted raid-style inspections, some at peak business hours, and "deliberately crafted" city ordinances targeting Ball & Chain . Thursday‚Äôs lawsuit comes days after a leaked memo from Police Chief Art Acevedo made similar claims against commissioners. This is the latest development in a public sparring match that spanned years. In 2019, Ball & Chain's co-owner, Bill Fuller, accused Commissioner Joe Carollo of illegally targeting his businesses after Fuller supported Carollo's political rivals. ‚ÄúThe lies, and the unethics, and the crimes that this man has committed, will come out for everyone," Fuller said in 2019. Carollo said at the time the ownership group was serving alcohol illegally at another business and that late-night clubs didn‚Äôt belong in the area. Local 6 to Know 13 hours ago 6 to know ‚Äì Top stories of the day Miami Gardens 2 hours ago Miami Gardens mayor speaks out about deadly dog attack as police update investigation ‚ÄúThis man has got a history of doing what he pleases, in violation of building laws, code enforcement," Carollo said back in 2019. Since then, the lawsuit alleged city leaders put in a plan to issue bogus code violations, and passed a law targeting Ball & Chain by creating new noise restrictions. Ball & Chain was shut down in November 2020, and Taquerias el Mexicano was shut down back in August. The lawsuit says a restaurant manager was unjustly arrested, but the charges were dropped later. Carollo told NBC 6 by phone Thursday night that he has yet to read the lawsuit, but will soon. ‚ÄúThis is going to read like some kind of novel, but very, very short on the truth," he said. ‚ÄúThis is yet another attempt on Mr. Fuller‚Äôs part to deflect his illegal management of properties and businesses onto the city. ¬†We look forward to addressing his conduct in court," said Victoria Mendez, the city's attorney.
